attributes.action: Stop the Selloff of Channel 4.
attributes.background: Channel 4 is a PSB broadcaster, which has produced high quality programming for the last 33 years, and is an important supporter of the British film industry. If the government sells it off as they plan to the British television industry will deteriorate, will become another channel 5.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-34354216 
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/channel-4-privatisation-would-be-an-ideological-fire-sale-labour-says-10516499.html 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/mediatechnologyandtelecoms/media/11671049/SUNDAY-INTERVIEW-Channel-4-chief-David-Abraham-prepares-for-privatisation-battlechannel-4-humans-david-abraham.html 
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/11/08/channel-4-privatisation-snp-john-nicolson_n_8504430.html

attributes.action: Increase pay for teaching assistants
attributes.background: Teaching assistants in the uk are no longer parents who clean paint pots and sharpen pencils. We are trained professionals responsible for children's education and well being. Pay hasn't risen (even with inflation) for years and this needs to change.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to approve nivolumab to treat advanced Kidney Cancer
attributes.background: Nivolumab has shown great promise in the treatment of kidney cancer. Following the 1st meeting to review the clinical trial evidence & cost-effectiveness of Nivolumab in treating kidney cancer, NICE has said it's unlikely they'll recommend the drug for this area. This stance needs reversing.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, more than 11,800 people were diagnosed with kidney cancer; that's about 33 people each day.  It is now the seventh most common cancer in the UK:  the fifth most common cancer in men and the tenth in women.  Since the late 1970s, kidney cancer incidence rates have more than doubled in Great Britain. With rising numbers each year, Nivolumab could make a huge difference to many people's lives.
attributes.creator_name: Malcolm Packer on behalf of Kidney Cancer UK

attributes.action: Make assaulting an SIA security person a specific offence.
attributes.background: Many individuals working within the security sector are assaulted by the public. This is often seen as a hazard of the job by the public and courts.The security sector is part of the wider police force. A specific offence of assaulting an SIA person would reduce incidents of violence against them.

attributes.action: Make Crown Indemnity available to all NHS GP practices in the UK.
attributes.background: Over one in ten full-time GPs pay sums greater than £10,000 a year for medical indemnity, while most are charged between £5,000 and £10,000. Rising indemnity fees could force more GPs into early retirement. The rising costs could also dissuade younger doctors from entering general practice.

attributes.action: Debate giving the British electorate an in / out referendum on TTIP
attributes.background: I strongly believe that the Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership should be debated in the House and the electorate of the British Isles be consulted, before any moves to either join the agreement through Parliament, or bi-laterally through EU agreements.

attributes.action: Make yoga and meditation mandatory in primary and secondary schools in UK.
attributes.background: Yoga and meditation for children offers a unique possibility for every child to experience a joyful blossoming of his or her potential.  Simple practices of yoga and meditation enhance a child's ability to learn. Doing yoga children connect more deeply within and to the natural world around them.
attributes.additional_details: Increasing research evidence shows that children derive enormous benefits from yoga and meditation. Physically, it enhances their flexibility, strength, coordination and awareness. Mentally, they have enhanced sense of calmness and relaxation and their concentration improves, resulting in overall wellbeing. By integrating physical movement with breathing exercises, yoga serves as a promising form of physical and cognitive training to enhance learning related outcomes. ( Butzer et al, in press )

attributes.action: Change legislation to enforce yellow box junctions around the Dartford Tunnel.
attributes.background: Changing current legislation would allow for the enforcement of yellow box junctions on the A206 approach to the Dartford Tunnels, J1A & 1B of the M25 via local authority powers. This will improve traffic flow in Dartford and surrounding areas when incidents and heavy congestion occur.
attributes.additional_details: Yellow box junctions are not currently enforceable outside of London.  Allowing Part 6 of the Traffic Management Act 2004 for England to be enabled around the Dartford Tunnel would allow for the civil enforcement (i.e. by local authorities) of moving traffic offences, such as yellow box junction enforcement. Enforcement of these offences in England outside London is currently the responsibility of police who do not have the resources to enforce this.

attributes.action: not to extend school hours - it would affect privately run after school clubs
attributes.background: If school hours are extended, it would impact privately run after school clubs greatly.  Schools/Clubs for dance/music/sport/brownies/cubs etc have been established to fit around school hours - it would not only effect business owners financially, but also associated areas such as local hall hire
attributes.additional_details: I personally run a large dance school with a huge monthly rent for leased studios and hired local halls. The studios are dormant during the day so I rely on an earlier start as possible - which currently means 4pm (and all day Saturday). But it's not just my business it would affect - but associated business - the local halls would get less business; the cafeteria at the leisure centre where my studios are based, would get less custom; dance wear shops would get less custom......

attributes.action: The petition calls upon MPs not to repeal the European Communities Act 1972
attributes.background: In the light of the close EU referendum result, which is not legally binding, the petition calls upon parliamentary sovereignty to be restored and for MPs not to repeal the European Communities Act 1972 which provides for UK membership of the European Union.

attributes.action: Increase the public sector pay by 5% NHS staff deserve a decent pay rise
attributes.background: People working in the public sector have years of no pay rises and when they do finally get the pittance of 1% it comes with increased pension costs and now increased NI contributions. Britain deserves a pay rise? So do the hard working NHS
attributes.additional_details: An independent study into regional pay in the public sector showed that in all areas of the country public servants were being underpaid compared to private counterparts before the recession and still so after. We've endured many years of working hard and taking it on the chin, hoping that when the country gets on its feet we would be recompensed with a better wage. Give us a fair deal. You have repeatedly said 'Britain needs a pay rise' MPs are getting 11% surely 5% is not asking a lot.

attributes.action: We are looking for the UK government to intervene regarding Lisa Brown's case
attributes.background: Lisa Brown a British Citizen who was living in Spain went missing on the 4th November the Spanish police are currently investigating this matter however we are not getting any further foward we need the British Police to become involved and push this investigation forward urgently
attributes.additional_details: This has been reported in the British Media and the Spanish we have a face group group of supporters of over 25000 people yet the investigation is very limited we require the support of the British Government to push the Spanish government to allow the British Police to intervene and move this case forward urgently

attributes.action: scrap universal credit..its not right and its not fair.people are not surviving
attributes.background: people who are unfortunate and are out of work have been put on universal credit..they are getting paid every nearly 5 weeks.how can the government expect people to try and survive like this.the amount of money is just a joke.the government  think its just 'dossers' but work is just so hard to find!
attributes.additional_details: this needs addressing before it gets out of hand...people are suffering..its time we stood up and we won our rights back!!!!

attributes.action: An urgent review of life saving cancer drugs
attributes.background: NICE ruled against an introduction of Zykadia (ceritinib) due to the cost to the NHS. Lung cancer is one of the biggest killers & currently patients are being denied life saving drugs. The drug in trials reduced tumours by 57% and increased survival by 16 months. This needs to be reviewed urgently.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.ukmi.nhs.uk/applications/ndo/record_view_open.asp?newDrugID=5856

attributes.action: Secretary of State for Health must be or have been a senior medical practitioner
attributes.background: Our NHS is a national treasure that is at breaking point.The fiasco that has ensued following the inept knowledge and experience of the current Secretary for Health,Jeremy Hunt.The audacity & arrogance in his behaviour & notions have demonstrated why we need medical people governing the health dept.

attributes.action: Stop the take over of Howe Barracks by the London Borough of Redbridge
attributes.background:
Over 200 families from the London Borough are set to move into the 208 homes that now sit in the Howe Barracks in Canterbury. 

Currently there are over 2,500 people on the Canterbury City Council Housing Register and surely these houses should be offered to them?
attributes.additional_details:
Let's get this discussed in Parliment as our local houses should be available to local people who need them the most.

See Kent Online for Evidence - 
http://www.kentonline.co.uk/canterbury/news/200-london-families-to-move-96359/

attributes.action: Relax working tax credit claim criteria for self-employed freelancers, artisans
attributes.background: Changes to the eligibility for working tax credits for the self-employed will have a devastating effect for the artisan, freelancer, sole trader, cottage industry and other very small, lesser commercial business for whom working tax credits are vital to survival.
attributes.additional_details: Small businesses do not make regular profit or have regular working hours, or can not be run on a larger scale commercial basis due to the need to keep overheads low. There is a definite gulf between the small, artisan or freelancer, and a larger commercially run business, such as a shop. In order for the lone worker to survive tax credits can be a vital resource to keep them afloat. A lone worker may also not be able to produce the proof necessary to back up their business. Relax the criteria.

attributes.action: Stop the change to the points system for Personal Independence Payments
attributes.background: George Osbourne plans to change the point system from two points to one point for disabled people who are trying to claim or already claiming PIP, he pulling the rug up from under disabled people, by making their lives even more difficult
attributes.additional_details: PIP is already extremely difficult to claim, I did not choose the have a disability ..neither did all the other disabled people in the uk, drug abusers receive more benefits than disabled people, what is going on with this crazy government

attributes.action: Public inquiry into misleading claims and pledges made during the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
We the undersigned call upon HM government to perform an inquiry into the pledges and claims made during the EU referendum campaign that were intended to deceive the British public. 

Misrepresenting the truth to get the British public to vote one way or another is an abuse of democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Statistics Authority told the Leave campaign the £350 million a week figure was misleading, Leave continued to use the figure. 

The Leave campaign stated that the level of immigration is putting pressure on the NHS. Since the result a Leave MP has said that the Leave campaign wish to "control" immigration, not necessarily reduce it. 

UKIP used an image on a poster showing migrants crossing the Croatia-Slovenia border, with the phrase "breaking point" to imply they were entering Britain.

attributes.action: Scrap the  Driver CPC
attributes.background: I'm a HGV DRIVER and a lot of my fellow drivers think that the CPC (Certificate of Professional Competence) is a waste of time and just a money making exercise for the government.
attributes.additional_details: We as a whole are professional drivers and although we all can learn new things the course is a complete waste of time and want it scrapped.

attributes.action: All UK residents to be placed on the Organ Donor Register.
attributes.background: My name is Natalie Kerr, I am 34 years old and four years ago I was fortunate enough to receive a double lung transplant which saved my life from a rare lung disease. Currently three people a day die waiting for an organ transplant in the UK due to a shortage of donors! I propose we change the law.
attributes.additional_details: There are currently around 10,000 people in the UK in need of an organ transplant and there simply aren't enough organs available. Could you imagine if this happened to one of your loved ones like it did to me, fortunately I was lucky and have had 4 extra amazing years with my two children, many people aren't so lucky! I propose that we change the law to automatically place all UK residents on the Organ Donor Register with a CHOICE to opt out. I strongly believe that this will save many lives!

attributes.action: For every new teacher to learn about Speech, Language and Communication Needs
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to include Speech, Language and Communication Needs (SLCN) as part of any initial teacher training package. All trainee teachers should learn about SLCN so that they are able to adapt their teaching strategies and fully support their students to succeed and achieve.
attributes.additional_details: In English Schools 20.9% of all children on Special Educational Needs (SEN) support & 14% of children that have an Education, Health and Care Plan (EHCP) have SLCN (DfE Schools, pupils and their characteristics: January 2016). Language Impairment is seven times more common than other developmental conditions such as autism (SCALES study 2016). Including SLCN on any initial teacher training package would raise awareness & allow new teachers to feel more confident at identifying these children.

attributes.action: Make smoking in and near children's parks and playgrounds against the law.
attributes.background: Yesterday a woman asked if it would bother me if she smoked in the playground while on the seesaw with her young daughter.  When I said it would bother me, she told me that my one year old son would turn out to be "arrogant" and smoked anyway.  Secondhand smoke, even outside, is dangerous for kids.
attributes.additional_details: Secondhand smoke has around 4000 chemicals, 50 of which cause cancer, and many others which are very dangerous, especially for children and pregnant women.  Thirdhand smoke is the smoke that is leftover as residue on surfaces.  If, for example, someone is smoking on a seesaw, the dangerous chemicals from that smoke will then be touched and possibly ingested by the children who will next use that playground equipment. Dogs are banned from kids' parks. Smoke should also be banned in and near them.

attributes.action: Keep the EU's environmental protection laws for the UK.
attributes.background:
“One just hopes that collaboration on these issues, conservation issues, will transcend political divisions” Sir David Attenborough 

A call for us to set aside our differences and secure a safe future for the environment as a nation.
attributes.additional_details:
'The EU’s record on environmental issues is arguably one of its greatest achievements. It has developed world-leading legislation on a range of issues, which have helped tackle water and air pollution, protected endangered species, and imposed tough safeguards on the use of genetically modified crops and potentially dangerous chemicals.' The Independent

Regardless of your opinions on Brexit, let us unite to secure a safe future for the environment as an independent nation.

attributes.action: Repeal SI 138 and allow exempted dogs who pose no danger, to live with keepers.
attributes.background: Repeal SI 138 and allow courts to add a suitable keeper at any point for any reason.  SI 138 does not protect the public - it kills dogs for the sake of killing dogs.
attributes.additional_details: If deemed to be of "type" a dog must pose no danger to be exempted. The courts assess the owner and/or keeper to ensure they are a fit and proper person. They ensure premises are secure. Defra brought in SI 138 stating  a dog that cannot live with its registered owner/keeper must be destroyed unless that owner/keeper dies or is seriously ill. This means friendly dogs who have people who are suitable to care for them  must die. This is not protecting the public. Reopen Keepership and repeal SI 138

attributes.action: Make illegal the slaughter of pregnant cows.
attributes.background: More than 150,000 pregnant cows are sent to slaughter each year in the UK. At least 40,000 of these cows are in the last stages of their pregnancy and are bearing calves capable of independent life. Approximately 90% of the cows are dairy cows. The foetus is still alive during the cow's slaughter.
attributes.additional_details: During slaughter the foetus is alive while its mother is stunned and slaughtered. This means that the foetus would still be living while its mother’s front feet, head and possibly hide are removed.  There is no legislation to protect unborn animals in abattoirs - even if they are days away from being born. To slaughter heavily pregnant animals and throw away fully formed foetuses is a barbarity.

attributes.action: Require a by-election if rules on election expenses are broken
attributes.background: Parliament should change the law so that a by-election is automatically triggered if the financial rules on electoral expenses are proved to have been broken. Without a by-election in these cases, the legitimacy of the MP's seat is questionable.

attributes.action: Only the UK Government can end the Dog epidemic we have in the UK.
attributes.background:
Only the Government making changes will prevent many thousands of healthy dogs being put too sleep for no reason other than no one wants them or can take them in.
I predict 240,000 dogs a year will have to be put down in just 12 months time !
JUST FOUR SIMPLE STEPS WILL END THE DOG EPIDEMIC.
-
attributes.additional_details:
1,BAN PET SHOPS OR ANY OTHER THIRD PARTY FROM SELLING PUPPIES.
2, BAN  IMPORTING OF PUPPIES UNDER THE AGE OF 6 MONTHS.
3,  STOP FREE ADVERTISING OF PUPPIES ON GUMTREE, PRELOVED ETC.
4,   BREEDING LICENCES SHOULD BE ISSUED FOR NO MORE THAN THREE BREEDING BITCHES.
WHICH WILL CLOSE DOWN ALL PUPPY BREEDING FACTORIES AND FARMS.

( ILLEGAL PUPPY FARMS. )
If pet shops cannot sell the illegally bred puppies and they cannot sell them on the free add sites,they will have to stop breeding them.

attributes.action: Give all Military Families ASTs instead of Service Licence to Occupy in SFAs
attributes.background: Military Service Families living in SFA do not have Tenancy Agreements so have minimal rights including No Right to Repair. Therefore they are forced to live in Sub-standard homes. They need the respect they deserve as part of the Armed Forces Covenant to enable them to have Family Harmony
attributes.additional_details: AST's would protect Families. Any Company servicing Military Housing should be able to be held accountable through law for leaving families in properties of dis-repair.

attributes.action: Not enforce physical assessment on Dla claimants if already in receipt of Dla
attributes.background: It's wrong to make people already in receipt of Dla have to reapply and have to go through assessment and medical assessment when they have already proved eligibility and have qualified and been in receipt of Dla for years just because you want to cut the deficit
attributes.additional_details:
We all know the esa medical has not been as successful as the government would like us to believe with many qenuienly sick people loosing much needed benefits and deemed fit for work many of which have felt so lost they have taken there own lives because they felt there was no other choice left to them 
We need to stop the government enforcing disabled people rightly getting Dla being told they don't qualify for a benefit they have been getting for years simply to save money

attributes.action: Increase carers earning limit
attributes.background: I received a letter from DWP saying I can earn £110 a week before my carers allowance is affected,how is this fair?With the new min wage at £7.20 ph working 16hours a week is £115.20 weekly,this means my carers allowance will stop. Please increase the earnings limit in line with the new living wage
attributes.additional_details: Letter from department for work and pensions disability and carers service. Letter dated 25/03/2016

attributes.action: Government to review PIP
attributes.background: The impact this has had on me, the mother of a daughter with a 26 year disability. Having gone through this assessment and been turned down it has opened my eyes to all those other people suffering the same indignities. Those not strong enough to fight and those no longer with us because of it.
attributes.additional_details: Article Crewe Chronicle dated January 20th 2016. Facebook page People against DWP and ATOS. This new sytem is making people with a disability feel isolated and alone. How qualified are ATOS in making these decisions. It will cost more in the long run as people turned down will then have to claim other benefits to assist in there daily living. The disabled society do not choose to be like they are. Put more money into tackling those who wrongly choose disability as an option.

attributes.action: Free British citizenship for all commonwealth soldiers and veterans
attributes.background: I am a South African, living in the uk, and think it's a disgrace, that I have to pay my way to get British citizenship. I have fought for the queen in Afghanistan yet I have to now pay, to live in the county I fought for!
attributes.additional_details: The fee for a settlement application within the UK will increase to £1,875. British citizen naturalisation fees for adults will increase to £1,156 and child registration fees to £936, which also represent 25% increases.2 Mar 2016

attributes.action: Mandatory course/examination on food & drink for allergies & intolerances
attributes.background: My wife recently found out she was a Coeliac and I am allergic to nuts, as a chef I can’t believe the amount of chefs and catering staff that have no idea what these intolerance, allergies and illnesses are and how they can affect people.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that many of the trained and un-trained catering employees don’t have training on intolerances, allergies and food based illnesses, with more and more people suffering from nut allergies, Coeliac disease, lactose intolerance, as well as the other food based allergies such as egg, soya, seafood, this issue must be dealt with before anyone else dies or becomes extremely ill.
The death of Paul Wilson who suffered a severe anaphylactic shock after ordering a meal from an Indian take away,

attributes.action: Birth and death certificates to be given to parents of stillborns from 21 weeks
attributes.background:
This christmas and new year just gone has been a living nightmare for myself and friend lauren who I met having both lost our babies at 22 weeks.
After delivering of our babies we where refused a birth and death certificate due to our babies gestation, and given only a printed out form with DOB etc
attributes.additional_details:
We found not having a legal document with our babies birth and death information on and also not being able to register them hard, even more so after seeing how perfectly formed they where at this gestation of pregnancy.
It is our strong beleif that parents of stillborns should be given the option to have these documents after loosing a much    wanted baby
We feel that if given these certificates we are able to prove our babies did exist.
They where not just a fetus they are our babies!

attributes.action: Allow subsidised MoD flights for family members to visit Falklands War Graves.
attributes.background: Widows and parents of British servicemen killed in the Falklands are required to pay the full fare of £2,200 to take chartered flights to visit their loved ones’ graves. This petition requests that the MoD allow family members full access to subsidised travel for the purpose of visiting war graves.

attributes.action: Give unmarried widows equal rights in registering paternity of their children
attributes.background: Joana's long-term cohabiting partner and father to her child died suddenly three weeks before the birth of their second child. As they were unmarried, she was obliged to prove her child's parentage upon the father's death. It was a costly and lengthy legal process, including providing DNA evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The 1953 birth and death certificate act does not allow registrars to have discretionary powers to register deceased parents when the parents are not married. 

We ask that registrars be given these powers to prevent widows from having to go through such a costly and dehumanising experience.

attributes.action: Make English and Welsh waterways a public right of way
attributes.background:
Currently if you'd like to enjoy English and Welsh waterways you're likely to be accused of trespassing because the bed and banks of rivers and canals are privately owned, unlike Scotland/the rest of the world.

I believe our rivers should be open to all to enjoy.
attributes.additional_details:
Info from www.canoe-england.org.uk:
Over 96% of river systems are without public access.
The legal situation is unfavorable for access.
Owners of riverbeds and banks have riparian property rights, but do not own the water.
Riparian owners can exercise control over access to inland waters where there is not a right of access.
The Govt has agendas for increasing access to coastlines, physical exercise, improving health and outdoor education. 

Access to our rivers should be a right!

attributes.action: Make it law that dogs must be kept on leads around livestock
attributes.background: For the second time in two years I have spent the last few hours trying to find our sheep who have been worried by a loose dog, we have a dead lamb and some very poorly ewes, last year we lost 13 ewes who were ready to lamb, this is happening all over the country and something needs to be done!

attributes.action: Ban supermarkets from packaging fruits and vegetables
attributes.background: Climate change is the single biggest threat to society. In addition, contamination by plastics has become a major issue with research saying that by 2050 there could be more plastics in the ocean than fish. A small, positive step would be to stop supermarkets from packaging fruits and vegetables.
attributes.additional_details:
Such a ban would: 
- Reduce pollution (lower packaging production, less resources spent on recycling, reduced methane emissions from landfill sites) 
- Reduce strain on recycling facilities thus stop the export of waste (67% of British plastic waste is exported to the far east) 
- Increase consumer choice by avoiding bundling and decrease food waste (15m tonnes of food waste in the UK) 
- Lower prices of food 
- Contribute to a long-term vision of a zero waste society

attributes.action: Pay those born before 6/4/55 their state pensions as promised!
attributes.background:
All my life i believed i could retire and claim my state pension when i turned 60, The Government have robbed us of 6 years! it's not fair!  
PLEASE SIGN if you agree.

attributes.action: Reintroduce Tier 1 Post Study Work Visa for Non-EU students
attributes.background: The discontinuation of this visa affects thousands of students yearly after completing their studies in the UK. Many of us want to stay here after graduating but the difficulty in getting a visa to do so makes it almost impossible. Having this visa be reintroduced would help us and the UK as well.

attributes.action: We want the UN to monitor the UK  EU   In-Out Referendum
attributes.background: We as a nation want this referendum among British citizens to be a fair one... With that in mind .... shouldn't we be asking an impartial adjudicator such as the UN to oversee the vote count and make sure its a fair result?????
attributes.additional_details:
David Cameron has now been forced to open the doors for us to have our say on our future as a nation with a Referendum in June this year.
2015 and previous elections proved how far political parties will go to cheat their way to a victory in local elections ... ballot boxes going missing, bogus postal votes, etc..... We want a fair referendum

attributes.action: Arthritis/Anklyosing Spondylitis to be added to the NHS medical exempt list.
attributes.background: Anklyosing Spondylitis is an auto-immune disease effecting more than 200,000 people in the UK. Currently there is no cure, so the only way to manage the pain and flare up's is to take medication... Taking 20 tablets+ daily and not having free prescriptions.
attributes.additional_details: I am petitioning for Anklyosing Spondylitis and Arthritis sufferers to be given free prescriptions and both conditions to be added to the NHS medical exempt list. This condition can affect any of us, and is usually diagnosed in your twenties. Having to pay for prescriptions or prescription pre-payments till you're sixty is not fair, and it needs to be added to the medical condition exempt form.

attributes.action: Water safety to be taught as part of the national curriculum age appropriate.
attributes.background: Our loved ones need to understand the dangers in & around open water. The effects cold water can have on the body, The difference between a pool that is sanitized temperature controlled & lifeguarded, To bodies of open water such as quarries, lakes, reservoirs, rivers, canals  that hold many dangers
attributes.additional_details: My son was born on the 17th October 1997 He died on the 3rd of July 2011 age 13 swimming with friends in open water.I believe had Dylan been educated about the dangers in & around open water he would still be with us like so many others would be.Awareness is Prevention.There is no cure for this.A persons swimming ability often makes no difference to whether a person lives or dies. Many who lose their lives in open water never intended on even entering the water.Over 400 accidental deaths a year.

attributes.action: Ban the Slaughter of Dartmoor Hill Ponies for Meat for Human Consumption
attributes.background: Dartmoor Hill Ponies are now being slaughtered for meat for human consumption. We call on the Government to halt the scheme which is both promoting moorland ponies as a meat product and also supplying the market. The Government must  enforce effective management of the Dartmoor Hill Pony herds.
attributes.additional_details: Apart from the fact we do not eat our companion animals here in the UK there are also concerns regarding the safety of the meat as, unlike farmed animals, the ponies are roaming free and their grazing is not monitored, therefore their meat may contain harmful substances such as wormers, bute and contraceptives.  The ponies are wild and unhandled and will be terrified at slaughter, their slaughter is inhumane.   Please sign this petition and help save  Dartmoor Hill Ponies from such cruelty!

attributes.action: Introduce 'Emily's Law' to ensure health and safety on privately-owned boats
attributes.background: 15 year old Emily Gardner from Gloucestershire died when her friend's boat capsized at sea. A catalogue of errors led to her death including the fact she was wearing a damaged and ill-fitting buoyancy aid. No laws currently exist to ensure that health and safety is observed on leisure craft.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tearful-mum-watches-schoolgirls-lifeless-8088025

https://assets.digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk/media/5614f0fce5274a6251000003/MAIBInvReport21_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Make teacher training on ADHD compulsory in schools
attributes.background: So many parents are fighting to get a diagnoses for their child and when they finally get a Adhd diagnoses schools don't know how to manage it or simply dont believe it. Schools need more training. Stop labelling our children naughty and learn about the condition. Adhd is more complex! Make a change

attributes.action: Recognise the UK standard of firearm deactivation as equivalent to EU standards.
attributes.background: Proposed legislation in the Policing and Crime Bill intends to enforce the application of a EU standard that will result in firearms previously deactivated to UK Home Office standards being classified as defectively deactivated.  The EU standard is inferior to the UK standard and unnecessary here.
attributes.additional_details: The UK standard of deactivation is acknowledged as the best in Europe, and makes it impossible to re-activate a firearm without completely rebuilding the weapon. Imposition of the EU standard in the UK is a complete waste of taxpayers money, is disrupting a process previously recognised by government as effective in taking live firearms out of circulation, and penalises owners by making it illegal to sell or transfer safe UK deactivated firearms that will be unfairly classified as ‘defective’.

attributes.action: Save the Human Rights Act
attributes.background: The Human Rights Act is an important act designed to protect each and every individual from inequality and injustice be it from another individual, corporations or our own government. As such the decision to remove or change that protection should, ultimately lie with the people of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
In the past we've been rightly proud of our tough stance around the world on human rights. 
The UK will not extradite to a country where the death penalty is used. UK politicians have called for Guantanamo to be closed and laws criminalising homosexuality in Africa and elsewhere to be overturned. 
We accept that the Conservative party won the 2015 General Election with a majority, however a decision on something as important as this has to have the backing of the majority of the electorate, not just the 36% that voted Conservative. We are therefore asking you to do the right democratic thing and bring your proposal for a 'British Bill of Rights' before the electorate in a referendum and let them decide if they wish to opt for this, or keep the existing Human Rights legislation.
